result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J. Hoffmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven J. Hoffmann is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven J. Hoffmann was found guilty of Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Obtain highschool diploma or it's equivalent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to 15CF21 and any other sentence now in being

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:00 am - DA calls cases 15CF21 and 15CM1 and states appearances. Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State and DE acknowlege receipt of rev packet. DA certifies victims rights compliance in both cases.  Comments by DA. Comments by Lex.  Court imposes:
15CF21 - 60 days jail cs to each other and any other sentences now in being and reimpose prior financial obligations still outstanding, 30 days to pay or CO
15CM1 - 60 days jail cs to each other and any other sentences now in being and reimpose prior financial obligations still outstanding,  30 days to pay or CO

Credit for time served 111 days served for each count.

Appeal rights given
for court hearing from DOC
Revocation Order and Warrant Amended; Order
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Modification of conditions of probation as alternative to revocation of probation
Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

11:17 am - 15CM1, 15CF21, 15CF22 - Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DA certifies victims rights compliance. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct. 2 in 15CM1 and Ct. 2 in 15CF21.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 2 in 15CM1 & Ct. 2 in 15CF21 and on motion of DA dismisses Ct. 1 in 15CM1 & Ct. 1 in 15CF21 and dismiss and read-in 15CF22 for purposes of repayment of service fees. Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 11:42 am. 
Court imposes:
15CM1 (Ct. 2): Sentence withheld - 2 years probation. Conditions: $243 court costs; $200 DNAAS; $100 DOMAB; Apology; Obtain highschool diploma or it's equivalent
15CF21 (Ct. 2): Sentence witheld - 2 years probation. Conditions: $243 court costs; $200 DNAAS and submit sample; Apology; Obtain highschool diploma or it's equivalent; $65 SBDA for 15CF22
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-01-2015 11:00 am
Status conference at 10-20-2015 11:00 am
Status conference at 08-25-2015 11:00 am

10:03 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court with attorney James R. Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of Dr Galli's report.  DE does not believe he is competent.  Argument by Atty's.  Court finds DE to be competent.
Competency hearing at 06-05-2015 10:00 am
notice of defendant's status

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.   Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may have NO CONTACT with Nicole Kerr, unless there is written consent on file.  DE must take all medications as prescribed.  DE may not consume controlled substances unless prescribed by physician. Defendant may not leave Price County without prior approval of Court except for medical and court appointments.

2:02 pm - New case (15CF21) & 15CM1 - Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comments regarding bond condition in both cases.  Bond to be modified in both cases allowing defendant to leave Price County for medical and court appointments.  Atty. Lex requests competency exam from Oneida County be in conjuction with Price County Cases.  So ordered. Adj. 2:05 pm.

DE may have NO CONTACT with Nicole Kerr, unless there is written consent on file.  DE must take all medications as prescribed.  DE may not consume controlled substances unless prescribed by physician.

Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Parties address bond issues.  Bond modified with same conditions.

10:07 am - Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person.  Defendant, in person, in custody.  Case called, appearances and possible charges stated.  Defendant's next court date is 03-03-15 at 10:00 am.  Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days to file complaint.  Court sets bond.
